meanings.definition: The process of introducing air into a substance.
meanings.sent1: Aeration is important for the health of fish in the aquarium.
meanings.sent2: The aeration of the soil helps plants grow better.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter needed aeration to rise properly in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The aeration of ideas during the meeting led to creative solutions.
meanings.sent5: Proper aeration of the lungs is essential for breathing well.

meanings.definition: The act of exposing to the action of air.
meanings.sent1: Aeration of the room made it feel fresher and more comfortable.
meanings.sent2: The aeration of the wine enhanced its flavor and aroma.
meanings.sent3: The aeration of the tires before a long trip ensured a smooth ride.
meanings.sent4: The aeration of the attic helped prevent mold and musty odors.
meanings.sent5: The aeration of the fabric allowed it to dry quickly after washing.
